title: of section 67 of the Courts of Justice Act 1936, and reconstituted pursuant to the
heading: 1. (1) These Rules, which may be cited as the Rules of the Superior Courts
text_raw:
1. (1) These Rules, which may be cited as the Rules of the Superior Courts 

(Companies Act 2014 Section 459) 2025, shall come into operation on 
the 16th day of May 2025. 

(2) These Rules shall be construed together with the Rules of the Superior 

Courts. 

(3) The Rules of the Superior Courts as amended by these Rules may be cited 

as the Rules of the Superior Courts 1986 to 2025.
text_norm: 1 (1) rule may cited rule superior court (companies act 2014 section 459) 2025 shall come operation 16th day may 2025 (2) rule shall construed together rule superior court (3) rule superior court amended rule may cited rule superior court 1986 2025

title: of section 67 of the Courts of Justice Act 1936, and reconstituted pursuant to the
heading: 2. The Rules of the Superior Courts are amended:
text_raw:
2. The Rules of the Superior Courts are amended: 

(i) 

by the insertion immediately following sub-rule (5) of rule 
18 of Order 75 of the following sub-rules: 

“(6) An originating notice of motion issued under 
section 459(10) or section 459(12) of the Act seeking an 
order for the payment out of all or any part of any moneys 
which were lodged under section 459(7)(c) or section 
459(9)(b) of the Act shall be served on the offeree company 
concerned. 

(7) An originating notice of motion under sub-rule (6) 
shall be grounded on an affidavit which sets out the basis of 
the applicant’s claim to be entitled to all or any part of any 
moneys concerned and verifies the facts, and exhibits and 
verifies any document, supporting the claim. 

(8) The Court may direct service of an originating 
notice of motion under sub-rule (6) on any other person and 
may direct the filing of any affidavit by the respondent or 
any other person on notice of the application.”; and 

(ii) by the insertion immediately following rule 91 of Order 77 

of the following caption and rule: 

“XII. Lodgment under section 459 of the Companies Act
text_norm: 2 rule superior court amended (i) insertion immediately following sub-rule (5) rule 18 order 75 following sub-rules (6) originating notice motion issued section 459(10) section 459(12) act seeking order payment part money lodged section 459(7)(c) section 459(9)(b) act shall served offeree company concerned (7) originating notice motion sub-rule (6) shall grounded affidavit set basis applicant claim entitled part money concerned verifies fact exhibit verifies document supporting claim (8) court may direct service originating notice motion sub-rule (6) person may direct filing affidavit respondent person notice application (ii) insertion immediately following rule 91 order 77 following caption rule xii lodgment section 459 company act

title: of section 67 of the Courts of Justice Act 1936, and reconstituted pursuant to the
of section 67 of the Courts of Justice Act 1936, and reconstituted pursuant to the
heading: 92. (1) Where an offeree company desires to lodge
text_raw:
92. (1) Where an offeree company desires to lodge 
money in accordance with section 459(7)(c) or (as the case 
may be) section 459(9)(b) of the 2014 Act, a duly 
authorised officer or member of the staff of the offeree 
company shall first swear and file an affidavit and schedule 
in the Form No. 20 in Appendix P, setting out: 

(a) 

(b) 

the name of the offeree company concerned; 

the date of, and parties to, the scheme, contract, 
or offer to which the intended lodgment relates; 

 
 
 4 [150] 

(c) 

(d) 

the total amount of money proposed to be 
lodged; 

the names of each of the persons believed by the 
offeree company to be entitled to any part of the 
money proposed to be lodged, the amount of, or 
share in, that money to which each such person 
is believed to be entitled, and the address or any 
other particulars of the whereabouts of each 
such person available to the offeree company; 
and 

(e) 

a statement that the lodgment is intended to be 
made pursuant to section 459(7)(c) or (as the 
case may be) section 459(9)(b) of the 2014 Act. 

(2) On the filing of a satisfactory affidavit in 
accordance with this rule, the Accountant shall authorise 
receipt of a lodgment proposed to be made. 

(3) At the expiration of seven years from the date of 
any lodgment pursuant to section 459 of the 2014 Act, the 
Accountant shall in accordance with section 459(11) of that 
Act transfer to the Exchequer the amount of the lodgment 
concerned then remaining unclaimed. 

(4) 

In this rule: 

the “2014 Act” means the Companies Act 2014; 

“offeree company” has the same meaning as in section 
457(1) of the 2014 Act.”

text_raw:

Rules of the Superior Courts immediately following Form No. 19.

and say as follows:

title: of section 67 of the Courts of Justice Act 1936, and reconstituted pursuant to the
heading: 2. X ltd/dac/plc (or as the case may be) of [address] was the offeree
text_raw:
2. X ltd/dac/plc (or as the case may be) of [address] was the offeree 
company, within the meaning of section 457(1) of the Companies Act 2014 
(hereinafter, the “2014 Act”) in a *[scheme, contract, or offer] which became 
effective on [date] and was made as between Y ltd/dac/plc (or as the case may 
be) of [address] (the “offeror”) and the offeree company.

title: of section 67 of the Courts of Justice Act 1936, and reconstituted pursuant to the
heading: 7. The names of the persons believed by the offeree company to be entitled
text_raw:
7. The names of the persons believed by the offeree company to be entitled 
to any part of the sum proposed to be lodged, the amount due to each such person, 
and the last known address and/or contact details of each such person, are as 
follows: 

Name 

Address or 
other 
contact 
details 

Number 
of shares 
held in the 
offeree 
company 

Percentage 
held of 
relevant 
shares 

Amount due 
(€)

title: of section 67 of the Courts of Justice Act 1936, and reconstituted pursuant to the
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These rules facilitate the operation of section 459(7) of the Companies Act 2014 
as amended, where there is a takeover of a company and the target, or offeree, 
company has not within seven years been able to pay over proceeds to 
shareholders who did not accept the offer. 

 
 
 
 
 8 [150]
